commented_code:
+---
+title: Overview
+---
+
+### About Jan
+Jan is a free, open source alternative to OpenAI's platform that runs on a local folder of open-format files. We believe in the need for an open source AI ecosystem, and are building the infra and tooling to allow open source AIs to be as usable and comprehensive as proprietary ones. Jan's long-term vision is to build a cognitive framework for future robots, who are practical, useful assistants for humans and businesses in everyday life.
+
+### Cross platform
+A free, open-source alternative to OpenAI that runs on the Linux, macOS, and Windows operating systems. Please refer to the specific guides below for your platform
+- [Linux](/getting-started/install/linux)
+- [macOS](/getting-started/install/macos)
+- [Windows](/getting-started/install/windows)
+
+Jan is lightweight and can run on a variety of hardware and platform versions. You can find the specific requirements for your platform below.
+
+### Requirements for Jan
+
+#### Hardware
+Jan is a small download (<100 MB) and has a disk footprint of under 300 MB. Being a lightweight platform, it should run smoothly on modern hardware. Additionally, as you will download, store and run open-source LLM models via Jan, we recommend that you have
+- At least 5 GB of free disk space
+- At least 8 GB of RAM

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@

+title: Overview
+---
+
+### About Jan
+Jan is a free, open source alternative to OpenAI's platform that runs on a local folder of open-format files. We believe in the need for an open source AI ecosystem, and are building the infra and tooling to allow open source AIs to be as usable and comprehensive as proprietary ones. Jan's long-term vision is to build a cognitive framework for future robots, who are practical, useful assistants for humans and businesses in everyday life.

+#### Hardware

+- At least 5 GB of free disk space
+- At least 8 GB of RAM
discussion_comments.comment_body:
We need to explain the different requirements for RAM and GPU VRAM. 

- RAM: using traditional computer
- VRAM: using GPU

We should also talk about how RAM and VRAM sizes relate to models that you can run, e.g: 

- 8gb of RAM of VRAM can only realistically run smaller models, e.g. 3B models or quantized 7B models
- 16gb is recommended as the "minimum usable models" are mostly at 7b (e.g. Mistral 7b)
- The really good models (e.g. 70b models) require at least X gb of RAM

You may need to do some reading up on r/localllama, and have a call with @hahuyhoang411 to get up to speed on this.

commented_code:
+---
+title: Overview
+---
+
+### About Jan
+Jan is a free, open source alternative to OpenAI's platform that runs on a local folder of open-format files. We believe in the need for an open source AI ecosystem, and are building the infra and tooling to allow open source AIs to be as usable and comprehensive as proprietary ones. Jan's long-term vision is to build a cognitive framework for future robots, who are practical, useful assistants for humans and businesses in everyday life.
+
+### Cross platform
+A free, open-source alternative to OpenAI that runs on the Linux, macOS, and Windows operating systems. Please refer to the specific guides below for your platform
+- [Linux](/getting-started/install/linux)
+- [macOS](/getting-started/install/macos)
+- [Windows](/getting-started/install/windows)
+
+Jan is lightweight and can run on a variety of hardware and platform versions. You can find the specific requirements for your platform below.
+
+### Requirements for Jan
+
+#### Hardware
+Jan is a small download (<100 MB) and has a disk footprint of under 300 MB. Being a lightweight platform, it should run smoothly on modern hardware. Additionally, as you will download, store and run open-source LLM models via Jan, we recommend that you have
+- At least 5 GB of free disk space
+- At least 8 GB of RAM
+
+#### Platform
+Jan is supported on the following platforms:
+- Linux
+- macOS (Mac Intel Chip and Apple Silicon Chip)
+- Windows (64-bit)

+---
+title: Overview
+---
+
+### About Jan
+Jan is a free, open source alternative to OpenAI's platform that runs on a local folder of open-format files. We believe in the need for an open source AI ecosystem, and are building the infra and tooling to allow open source AIs to be as usable and comprehensive as proprietary ones. Jan's long-term vision is to build a cognitive framework for future robots, who are practical, useful assistants for humans and businesses in everyday life.
+
+### Cross platform
+A free, open-source alternative to OpenAI that runs on the Linux, macOS, and Windows operating systems. Please refer to the specific guides below for your platform
+- [Linux](/getting-started/install/linux)
+- [macOS](/getting-started/install/macos)

+
+Jan is lightweight and can run on a variety of hardware and platform versions. You can find the specific requirements for your platform below.
+
+### Requirements for Jan
+
+#### Hardware
+Jan is a small download (<100 MB) and has a disk footprint of under 300 MB. Being a lightweight platform, it should run smoothly on modern hardware. Additionally, as you will download, store and run open-source LLM models via Jan, we recommend that you have
+- At least 5 GB of free disk space
+- At least 8 GB of RAM
+
+#### Platform
+Jan is supported on the following platforms:
+- Linux
+- macOS (Mac Intel Chip and Apple Silicon Chip)
+- Windows (64-bit)
discussion_comments.comment_body:
We should also talk about CPU and GPU support. 

CPU: 
- ARM
- x86

GPU: 
- Nvidia (thru llama.cpp)
- Talk about additional support coming soon for AMD and Intel

For the GPU portion, you will need to get 15min of @tikikun's time to grok which GPU architectures we currently support, and what we don't.

commented_code:
---
 title: Installing Jan on Windows
----
\ No newline at end of file
+---
+
+# Windows users
+## Step 1: Download the Installer
+To begin using 👋Jan.ai on your Windows computer, follow these steps:
+
+1. Visit [Jan.ai](https://jan.ai/).
+2. Click on the "Download for Windows" button to download the Jan Installer.
+
+![Jan Installer](img/jan-download.png)
+
+## Step 2: Proceed the Windows Defender
+
+When you run the Jan Installer, Windows Defender may display a warning. Here's what to do:
+
+1. Click "Run away" to accept and install 👋Jan.ai.
+
+![Accept Jan](img/window-defender.png)
+
+2. Wait for the 👋Jan.ai installation to complete.
